A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This film is an unfocused mess\, whose attempts to break free of what it obviously considers the millstone of the original trilogy’s lore and chart a new course come off as needlessly irreverent and hollow. It simultaneously squanders the promise and goodwill of The Force Awakens while failing to shore up its predecessor’s shortcomings. Full of narrative cul-de-sacs and baffling missed opportunities that see key characters treading water\, some truly bizarre innovations\, and an insistence on second-rate pop culture jokes that consistently undermine the emotional weight the movie seeks to achieve\, it gives one reason to wonder whether Rian Johnson truly understands or even loves Star Wars.
